game_title: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade

review: youre playing oliver vertran a descendant of a noble family trying to solve the riddle of the demise of his family while being corrupted by dark powers  the story and world design is sublime the art is beautiful voice acting is good and this is probably the most fun betrothal between visual novel and point and click adventure i have ever played so far

review: i was given this game as a gift and wow just wow   this game has an amazing story i have yet to finish it but ive loved it so far the art is just wonderful and the writing is fantastic and dark theres nothing bad i have to say when i thought they were going to go one way with the story you get a twist you werent expecting   if youre looking for a good visual novel without 90 nakedshirtless chicks and an actual story heres one for you

review: kicked invisible chicken died instantly  410  honestly the story is good and the art is good  the navigatin is a bit tedius though and there are elements that just dont fit like they should the weird menus etc  i dont know i guess pick it up if you really like adventures and its on sale  otherwise dont bother
game_title: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade

review: this game in 5 episodes half visual novel and half pointandclick has the merit of being very original first of all its scenario skillfully mixes mystery horror and a bit of steampunk then the graphics have a rather unique style but that wont please everyone finally the characters are really endearing at first the game had some serious bugs but they had been fixed recommended
game_title: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade

review: leviathan is a heavily storydriven point and click adventure game the story and characters were good enough to keep my interest though the gameplay elements were lacking the choices you make have an effect on the games outcome which feels a bit abrupt but was still satisfying   pros  decent story  interesting characters  choices affect the storys progression  distinct art style  cons  very simple gameplay  lots of reading there is no voice work
game_title: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade

review: pros very good art interesting story characters with personality you can choose to be evil or good  cons you can miss some side events if you dont thoroughly check city and your phone after every main event there could be a little more locations

game_title: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade

review: a point  click with great world building  the english translation is a bit rough like google translate rough but it isnt too distracting  the story is great and gives you plenty of choices that have weight and meaning  it maintains a sense of reality with being morally grey and not putting everything into black and white  definitely worth a play  i was really bummed when i finished ep 4 and saw that 5 hasnt been translated to english yet  i am eager to finish
game_title: Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade

review: set in a dystopian world ruled by an aristocracy where magic exists but is considered immoral    the game has an interesting story and a really nice art to complement it the games have puzzles which are logical no early 90s sierra nonsense puzzles and that ties seamlessly into the story  the only downer is that not all episodes are released yet currently the last episodes are not available yet
